columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the internal growth rate of the company using the total assets, the beginning assets, and the ending assets of the company.

## Internal Growth Rate
\
The internal growth rate is referred to as the initial maximum rate of growth attainable by a company without the need for external financing. It is the rate that the company could acquire with only internal financing.

## Required (1)
\
Now, let us determine the internal growth rate using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Beginning Equity|\$145,000|
|Total Assets|\$210,000|
|Net Income|\$27,000|
|Dividends|\$5,800|

## Accounting Return on Assets
\
Accounting Return on Assets is referred to as the financial measure of the company's profitability based on its assets. The ROA is computed by dividing the net income of the company by the total assets.

## Retention Ratio
\
The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

Now, let us compute the internal growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Internal Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROA} \times b}{1-\text{ROA}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1286\times 79\%}{1-0.1286\times 79\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1016}{1-0.1016}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1016}{0.8984}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.1131}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{11.31\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
Where:
ROA= Return on Assets
*b*= Retention Ratio
 
**The internal growth rate of the company is 11.31\%.**

## Required (2)
\
Now, let us determine the internal growth rate using the beginning equity of the company.

## Required (3)
\
Now, let us determine the internal growth rate using the ending equity of the company.

Since the total assets used to determine the internal growth rate of the company in the first requirement is the ending assets, the rate to be arrived at using the ending assets to compute the internal growth rate is 11.31\% as shown in the computation in the preceding steps.

## Required (4)
\
Now, let us analyze the computed amounts for the internal growth rate.

The computed internal growth rates are as follows:
 
<center>

|Determination of the Internal  Growth Rate|Internal  Growth Rate|
|:--|--:|
|Using the Total Assets|11.31\%|
|Using the Beginning Assets|11.30\%|
|Using the Ending Assets|11.31\%|

Based on the table in the preceding step, the computed internal growth rate under the three assumptions results in the same rate of internal growth (the discrepancies in the values are due to the rounding off of the decimal places in the computation).
\
This is due to the fact that despite the difference in the amount of the assets used in the calculation, the formulas used are modified in accordance with the assumption of the assets used to arrive at the internal growth rate.
